title: VOCABULARY
text:
Vocabulary Tables
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: A unique identifier for each Vocabulary, such as ICD9CM, SNOMED, Visit.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: The name describing the vocabulary, for example “International Classification of Diseases, Ninth Revision, Clinical Modification, Volume 1 and 2 (NCHS)” etc.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: External reference to documentation or available download of the about the vocabulary.





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: Version of the Vocabulary as indicated in the source.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key that refers to a standard concept identifier in the CONCEPT table for the Vocabulary the VOCABULARY record belongs to





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: A reference to the position in the ETL code responsible for bringing in this row level data

title: VISIT_DETAIL
text:
Standard Clinical Data Table
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A unique identifier for each Person’s visit or encounter at a healthcare provider.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the visit is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This field contains a concept id representing the kind of visit detail, like inpatient or outpatient. All concepts in this field should be standard and belong to the Visit domain.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The start date of the visit.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The date and time when the visit started. This defaults to 00:00:00 (midnight) if no time information is available.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The end date of the visit. If this is a one-day visit the end date should match the start date.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The date and time when the visit ended.This defaults to 00:00:00 (midnight) if no time information is available.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: Use this field to understand the provenance of the visit detail record, or where the record comes from.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was associated with the visit.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the care site in the care site table that was visited.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source ID for the visit as it appears in the source data; this corresponds to the Epic Clarity pat_enc_csn_id for STARR-OMOP.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to a Concept that repersents a distinct combination of the following three variables: ADT patient class, hospital admission type, and encounter type. One or more of these variables may be null for any given visit.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the admitting source as it appears in the source data.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the ‘Place of Service’ Vocabulary reflecting the admitting source for a visit.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the discharge disposition as it appears in the source data.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the ‘Place of Service’ Vocabulary reflecting the discharge disposition for a visit.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the VISIT_DETAIL table of the visit immediately preceding this visit





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the VISIT_DETAIL table record to represent the parent Visit Detail this Visit Detail belongs to, to allow for multiple levels of nested visits.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key that refers to the record in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table. This is a required field, because every visit_detail is associated with a visit_occurrence and cannot exist without a corresponding record in visit_occurrence





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code resposible for bringing in this row data





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is the name of the primary Clarity table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced

title: PROVIDER
text:
Standarized Health System Data Tables
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A unique identifier for each Provider.





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: A description of the Healthcare Provider.





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: The National Provider Identifier (NPI) of the providers in the US by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS).





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: This is the identifier issued by the DEA, a US federal agency, that allows a provider to write prescriptions for controlled substances.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: This is the CARE_SITE_ID for the location that the provider primarily practices in.





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This field either represents the most common specialty that occurs in the data or the most specific concept that represents all specialties listed, should the provider have more than one.





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The year of birth of the Provider.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The gender of the Provider.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: The identifier used for the Provider in the source data, stored here for reference.





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the Provider specialty as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source.





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: The gender code for the Provider as it appears in the source data, stored here for reference.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to a Concept that refers to the code used in the source for storing the providers gender





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code resposible for bringing in this row data





Required: No
Contains PHI: No
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is the name of the primary Clarity table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced

title: PERSON
text:
Standard Clinical Data Table
The following columns are available in this table:



Required:
Contains PHI:
Data Type:
Description: nan





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A unique identifier for each person.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This field is meant to capture the biological sex at birth of the Person. This field should not be used to study gender identity issues.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The year of birth of the person. For data sources with date of birth, the year is extracted. For data sources where the year of birth is not available, the approximate year of birth is derived based on any age group categorization available.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The month of birth of the person. For data sources that provide the precise date of birth, the month is extracted and stored in this field.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The day of the month of birth of the person. For data sources that provide the precise date of birth, the day is extracted and stored in this field.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The date and time of birth of the person.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This field captures race or ethnic background of the person.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This field captures ethnicity as defined by the Office of Management and Budget (OMB) of the US Government: it distinguishes only between “Hispanic” and “Not Hispanic”. Races and ethnic backgrounds are not stored here.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the place of residency for the person in the location table, where the detailed address information is stored. This field should capture the last known location of the person.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the primary care provider the person is seeing in the provider table.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the site of primary care in the care_site table, where the details of the care site are stored.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: An (encrypted) key derived from the person identifier in the source data. This is necessary when a use case requires a link back to the person data at the source dataset. In STARR-OMOP person_source_value is: MRN | D.O.B.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the gender of the person as it appears in the source data. The person’s gender is mapped to a standard gender concept in the Standardized Vocabularies; the original value is stored here for reference.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the gender concept that refers to the code used in the source.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the race of the person as it appears in the source data. The person race is mapped to a standard race concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original value is stored here for reference.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the race concept that refers to the code used in the source.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the ethnicity of the person as it appears in the source data. The person ethnicity is mapped to a standard ethnicity concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the ethnicity concept that refers to the code used in the source.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference to the position in the ETL code resposible for bringing in this row data





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is the name of the primary Clarity table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced

title: OBSERVATION_PERIOD
text:
Standard Clinical Data Table
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A unique identifier for each observation period. A Person can have multiple discrete Observation Periods which are identified by the Observation_Period_Id.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key identifier to the person for whom the observation period is defined. The demographic details of that person are stored in the person table.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The start date of the observation period for which data are available from the data source.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The end date of the observation period for which data are available from the data source.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This field. stores the provenance of the Observation Period as in whether the period was determined from an insurance enrollment file, EHR healthcare encounters, or other sources.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No

Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code resposible for bringing in this row data

title: NOTE
text:
Standard Clinical Data Table
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A unique identifier for each note.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key identifier to the Person about whom the Note was recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The date the note was recorded.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The date and time the note was recorded.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: Concept id that describes the provenance of the note.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the HL7 LOINC Document Type Vocabulary classification of the note.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: In our OMOP this column ususally refers the note type. (Procedure note type, h&p etc)





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: The content of the Note.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the note character encoding type





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the language of the note





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Provider in the PROVIDER table who took the Note.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Visit in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table when the Note was taken.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Visit in the VISIT_DETAIL table when the Note was taken.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source value associated with the origin of the Note - In this case it often the clarity note_id (from hno_note)





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code responsible for bringing in this row level data

Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: Concept id that describes the provenance of the note.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the HL7 LOINC Document Type Vocabulary classification of the note.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: In our OMOP this column ususally refers the note type. (Procedure note type, h&p etc)





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: The content of the Note.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the note character encoding type





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the language of the note





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Provider in the PROVIDER table who took the Note.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Visit in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table when the Note was taken.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Visit in the VISIT_DETAIL table when the Note was taken.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source value associated with the origin of the Note - In this case it often the clarity note_id (from hno_note)





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code responsible for bringing in this row level data

title: MEASUREMENT
text:
Standard Clinical Data Table
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A unique identifier for each Measurement.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key identifier to the Person about whom the measurement was recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The standard concept_id that the measurement_source_value maps to





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The date of the Measurement. If there are multiple dates in the source data associated with a record such as order_date, draw_date, and result_date, we choose the one that is closest to the date the sample was drawn from the patient.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The date and time of the Measurement.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The time of the Measurement. This is present for backwards compatibility and will be deprecated in an upcoming version





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The measurement_type_concept_id that best represents the provenance of the record, for example whether it came from an EHR record or billing claim.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key identifier to the predefined Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the mathematical operator that is applied to the value_as_number. Operators are <, <=, =, >=, > and these concepts belong to the ‘Meas Value Operator’ domain.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: FLOAT
Description: This is the numerical value of the Result of the Measurement, if available. Note that measurements such as blood pressures will be split into their component parts i.e. one record for systolic, one record for diastolic.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: If the raw data gives a categorial result for measurements those values are captured and mapped to standard concepts in the ‘Meas Value’ domain.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to a Standard Concept ID of Measurement Units in the Standardized Vocabularies that belong to the ‘Unit’ domain.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: FLOAT
Description: The lower limit of the normal range of the Measurement result. The lower range is assumed to be of the same unit of measure as the Measurement value.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: FLOAT
Description: The upper limit of the normal range of the Measurement. The upper range is assumed to be of the same unit of measure as the Measurement value.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the provider in the PROVIDER table who was responsible for initiating or obtaining the measurement.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Visit in the VISIT_OCCURRENCE table during which the Measurement was recorded.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Visit Detail in the VISIT_DETAIL table during which the Measurement was recorded.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: The Measurement name as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a Standard Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to a Concept in the Standard Vocabularies that refers to the code used in the source.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the unit as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard unit concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is stored here for reference.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source value associated with the content of the value_as_number or value_as_concept_id as stored in the source data.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code resposible for bringing in this row data





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is the name of the primary Clarity table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced

title: IMAGE_OCCURRENCE
text:
Clinical Data Table (not yet a Standard)
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A system-generated unique identifier for each Image Occurrence event.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Drug. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The unique key is given to a procedure record for a person. Links to the Procedure_occurrence table.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The unique key is given to the visit record for a person. Links to the Visit_occurrence table





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Anatomical location of the imaging procedure by the medical acquisition device (gross anatomy). It maps the ANATOMIC_SITE_SOURCE_VALUE to a Standard Concept in the Spec Anatomic Site domain. This should be coded at the lowest level of granularit





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Web Access to DICOM Objects via Restful Web Services Uniform Resource Identifer on study level





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Local path to the folder containing the image object file (access via a storage block access protocol)





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: DATE
Description: The date the imaging procedure occurred





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: DICOM Study UID(unique identifier). One study can include several series.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: DICOM Series UID (unique identifier).





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A label that defines the imaging procedures and usually refers to the type of imaging device used. It is of the attributes of the DICOM file (e.g., US, CT, MR, PT, DR, CR, NM).





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A unique identifier assigned to a patient’s specimen or procedure order when it is entered into the system. Note that accession numbers may not be unique accross departments, but are usually unique accross modalities.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The primary hospital system the data is sourced from.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The primary starr-common table the data is sourced from.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced

title: DRUG_STRENGTH
text:
Vocabulary Tables
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table representing the identifier for Branded Drug or Clinical Drug Concept.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table, representing the identifier for drug Ingredient Concept contained within the drug product.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: FLOAT
Description: The numeric value associated with the amount of active ingredient contained within the product.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table representing the identifier for the Unit for the absolute amount of active ingredient.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: FLOAT
Description: The numeric value associated with the concentration of the active ingredient contained in the product





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table representing the identifier for the numerator Unit for the concentration of active ingredient.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: FLOAT
Description: The amount of total liquid (or other divisible product, such as ointment, gel, spray, etc.).





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Concept in the CONCEPT table representing the identifier for the denominator Unit for the concentration of active ingredient.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The number of units of Clinical of Branded Drug, or Quantified Clinical or Branded Drug contained in a box as dispensed to the patient





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: DATE
Description: The date when the Concept was first recorded. The default value is 1-Jan-1970.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: DATE
Description: The date when the concept became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new Concept. The default value is 31-Dec-2099.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Reason the concept was invalidated. Possible values are ‘D’ (deleted), ‘U’ (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A reference to the position in the ETL code responsible for bringing in this row level data

title: CONCEPT
text:
Vocabulary Tables
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A unique identifier for each Concept across all domains.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: An unambiguous, meaningful and descriptive name for the Concept.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A foreign key to the DOMAIN table the Concept belongs to.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A foreign key to the VOCABULARY table indicating from which source the Concept has been adapted.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The attribute or concept class of the Concept. Examples are ‘Clinical Drug’, ‘Ingredient’, ‘Clinical Finding’ etc.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: This flag determines where a Concept is a Standard Concept, i.e. is used in the data, a Classification Concept, or a non-standard Source Concept. The allowables values are ‘S’ (Standard Concept) and ‘C’ (Classification Concept), otherwise the content is NULL.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The concept code represents the identifier of the Concept in the source vocabulary, such as SNOMED-CT concept IDs, RxNorm RXCUIs etc. Note that concept codes are not unique across vocabularies.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: DATE
Description: The date when the Concept was first recorded. The default value is 1-Jan-1970, meaning, the Concept has no (known) date of inception.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: DATE
Description: The date when the Concept became invalid because it was deleted or superseded (updated) by a new concept. The default value is 31-Dec-2099, meaning, the Concept is valid until it becomes deprecated.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Reason the Concept was invalidated. Possible values are D (deleted), U (replaced with an update) or NULL when valid_end_date has the default value.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: A reference to the position in the ETL code responsible for bringing in this row level data

title: DRUG_EXPOSURE
text:
Standard Clinical Data Table
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A system-generated unique identifier for each Drug utilization event.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key identifier to the Person who is subjected to the Drug. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The standard concept_id belonging to the ‘Drug’ domain.that the drug_source_value maps to.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The start date for the current instance of Drug utilization. Valid entries include a start date of a prescription, the date a prescription was filled, or the date on which a Drug administration procedure was recorded.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The start date and time for the current instance of Drug utilization. Valid entries include a start datetime of a prescription, the date and time a prescription was filled, or the date and time on which a Drug administration procedure was recorded.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The end date for the current instance of Drug utilization. Depending on different sources, it could be a known or an inferred date and denotes the last day at which the patient was still exposed to Drug.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The end date and time for the current instance of Drug utilization. Depending on different sources, it could be a known or an inferred date and time and denotes the last day at which the patient was still exposed to Drug.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The known end date of a drug_exposure as provided by the source.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The type_concept_id can be used to delineate between prescriptions written vs. prescriptions dispensed vs. medication history vs. patient-reported exposure, etc.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The reason the Drug was stopped. Reasons include regimen completed, changed, removed, etc.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This is only filled in when the record is coming from a prescription written. This field is meant to represent intended refills at time of the prescription.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: FLOAT
Description: The quantity of drug as recorded in the original prescription or dispensing record.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The number of days of supply of the medication as prescribed. This reflects the intention of the provider for the length of exposure.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: This is the verbatim instruction for the drug as written by the provider.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key that refers to a Standard Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies reflecting the route of administration and belonging to the ‘Route’ domain.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: An identifier assigned to a particular quantity or lot of Drug product from the manufacturer.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The Provider associated with drug record, e.g. the provider who wrote the prescription or the provider who administered the drug.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The Visit during which the drug was prescribed, administered or dispensed.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the Visit Detail in the VISIT_DETAIL table during which the Drug Exposure was initiated.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the Drug as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a Standard Drug concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to a Drug Concept that refers to the code used in the source.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The information about the route of administration as detailed in the source.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The information about the dose unit as detailed in the source.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code resposible for bringing in this row data





Required: No

Data Type: STRING
Description: Is the name of the primary Clarity table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced

title: PROCEDURE_OCCURRENCE
text:
Standard Clinical Data Table
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A system-generated unique identifier for each Procedure Occurrence.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The person_id of the person for whom the procedure is recorded.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key that refers to a standard procedure Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The date on which the Procedure was performed.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The date and time on which the Procedure was performed.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This field can be used to determine the provenance of the Procedure record, as in whether the procedure was from an EHR system, insurance claim, registry, or other sources.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The modifiers are intended to give additional information about the procedure.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The quantity of procedures ordered or administered. If the quantity value is omitted, a single procedure is assumed.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The provider in the PROVIDER table who was responsible for carrying out the procedure.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The visit during which the procedure occurred





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: The VISIT_DETAIL record during which the Procedure occurred. For example, if the Person was in the ICU at the time of the Procedure the VISIT_OCCURRENCE record would reflect the overall hospital stay and the VISIT_DETAIL record would reflect the ICU stay during the hospital visit.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the Procedure as it appears in the source data. This code is mapped to a standard procedure Concept in the Standardized Vocabularies and the original code is, stored here for reference. Procedure source codes are typically ICD-9-Proc, CPT-4, HCPCS or OPCS-4 codes.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: This is the concept id representing the procedure source value and may not necessarily be standard.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: This field houses the verbatim value from the source data representing the modifier code for the procedure that occurred





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code responsible for bringing in this row data





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is the name of the primary Clarity table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced

title: RELATIONSHIP
text:
Vocabulary Tables
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The type of relationship captured by the relationship record.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The text that describes the relationship type.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Defines whether a relationship defines concepts into classes or hierarchies. Values are 1 for hierarchical relationship or 0 if not.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Defines whether a hierarchical relationship contributes to the concept_ancestor table. These are subsets of the hierarchical relationships. Valid values are 1 or 0.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The identifier for the relationship used to define the reverse relationship between two concepts.

Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key that refers to an identifier in the CONCEPT table for the unique relationship concept.

title: VISIT_OCCURRENCE
text:
Standard Clinical Data Table
The following columns are available in this table:



Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A unique identifier for each Person’s visit or encounter at a healthcare provider.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key identifier to the Person for whom the visit is recorded. The demographic details of that Person are stored in the PERSON table.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key that refers to a Concept identifier in the Standardized Vocabularies belonging to the ‘Visit’ Domain (inpatient, emergency room, etc).





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The start date of the visit.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The date and time when the visit started. This defaults to 00:00:00 (midnight) if no time information is available.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATE
Description: The end date of the visit. If this is a one-day visit the end date should match the start date.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: DATETIME
Description: The date and time when the visit ended.This defaults to 00:00:00 (midnight) if no time information is available.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: Use this field to understand the provenance of the visit record, or where the record comes from.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the provider in the provider table who was associated with the visit.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the care site in the care site table that was visited.





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: This column contains a text string that concatenates the fields used to determine the visit_type. The following fields are concatenated in this order, with ‘ | ‘ separators: encounter type (enc_type_c), admission/discharge/transfer patient class (adt_pat_class_c), hospital admission type (hosp_admsn_type_c), and visit type (appt_prc_id)





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to a Concept that repersents a distinct combination of the following three variables: ADT patient class, hospital admission type, and encounter type. One or more of these variables may be null for any given visit.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined concept in the Visit Domain reflecting where the patient was admitted from.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for where the patient was admitted from as it appears in the source data.





Required: Yes
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the predefined Concept in the Visit Domain reflecting where the patient was discharged to (discharge disposition).





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: The source code for the discharge disposition as it appears in the source data.





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: INTEGER
Description: A foreign key to the VISIT_OCCURRENCE row of the visit immediately preceding this visit





Required: No
Contains PHI: Yes
Data Type: STRING
Description: A json string with the primary keys of the table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is a reference for the position in the ETL code resposible for bringing in this row data





Required: No
Contains PHI:
Data Type: STRING
Description: Is the name of the primary Clarity table in Clarity where most of the information for a given row is sourced
